jobPostingInfo.title: Flight System Systems Engineer II (NISAR/Europa/SRL)
jobPostingInfo.jobDescription:
Job Details

New ideas are all around us, but only a few will change the world. That’s our focus at JPL. We ask the biggest questions, then search the universe for answers—literally. We build upon ideas that have guided generations, then share our discoveries to inspire generations to come. Your mission—your opportunity—is to seek out the answers that bring us one step closer. If you’re driven to discover, create, and inspire something that lasts a lifetime and beyond, you’re ready for JPL.

Located in Pasadena, California, JPL has a campus-like environment situated on 177 acres in the foothills of the San Gabriel Mountains and offers a work environment unlike any other: we inspire passion, foster innovation, build collaboration, and reward excellence.

Responsibilities:

If you are passionate about spacecraft design, we invite you to join the Flight Systems Engineering, Integration and Test Section (313). We provide systems engineering for the design and implementation of spacecraft for the laboratory’s key flight projects. Our work spans spacecraft systems engineering, payload systems integration, electrical systems integration, fault protection and autonomy design, landing systems design, spacecraft assembly and test, systems verification and validation, and systems modeling.

We are seeking a highly motivated and experienced Systems Engineer II to join the Flight System Systems Engineering Group (313E), reporting administratively to the Technical Group Supervisor and programmatically to the Lead Systems Engineer. Your initial assignment will be to serve as a flight system systems engineer on the NISAR, Europa Clipper, or Mars Sample Return Lander projects. Some of your initial tasks may include test planning, execution, and analysis for flight system hardware and software, as well as requirements development, management, and closure.

You will work independently and within a team environment, collaborating on tasks performed across a spectrum of disciplines and have excellent writing and oral presentation skills.

Tasks may include but not limited to:

  • Ownership of a spacecraft functional area, such as Information Systems, Propulsion, or Data Management, with responsibilities for developing functional requirements and capabilities

  • Develop trade studies, risk analysis, and engineering change requests for a functional area

  • Develop and execute Verification and Validation (V&V) plans via analysis and test in a hardware testbed environment

  • Analyze test data to support closure of requirement or anomaly resolution

  • Participate in systems level testing in the hardware testbed and Systems I&T on the flight vehicle

  • Collaborate with Subject Matter Experts and subsystem delivery engineers to develop system requirements, establish interfaces, and flow down performance budgets

Qualifications:

  • Bachelor’s degree in Engineering, Physics, or related technical discipline with a minimum of 3 years of professional experience, or Master’s degree with a minimum of 1 years of experience, or Ph.D with no professional experience.

  • Experience with spacecraft functions and hardware in analysis, design, hardware delivery, or testing.

  • Experience with development and delivery of system documentation (requirements, test plans, and design description documents).

  • Experience on flight projects in requirement development and flowdown, integration and test, and/or verification and validation.

  • Proven ability to work effectively in a multidisciplinary and multi-organizational team; ability to work on major project assignments without appreciable direction with accountability for technical performance.

Preferred Skills:

  • Hardware and software testing experience, with an emphasis on analysis, troubleshooting, and debugging

  • Familiarity with Doors Next Generation

  • Scripting experience, preferably Python

  • Technical knowledge and experience in one of the following domains: Telecommunications, Avionics, Information Systems and Data Management, Propulsion, GNC.

  • Experience with JPL flight projects

  • Willingness to obtain a security clearance if asked.

JPL has a catalog of benefits and perks that span from the traditional to the unique. This includes a variety of health, dental, vision, wellbeing, and retirement plans, paid time off, learning, rideshare, childcare, flexible schedule, parental leave and many more. Our focus is on work-life balance, and living healthy, fulfilling lives as we Dare Mighty Things Together. For benefits eligible positions, benefits are effective the first day of the month coincident with or immediately following the employee’s start date.

For further benefits information click Benefits and Perks
